Pixeval requires WebView2 Runtime as a countermeasure of the new auth method of Pixiv, go to https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=2124703 to download the runtime and install it, the link has been copied to your clipboard, restart Pixeval after your installation
Indicates how many pages will be searched during an illust searching, each page contains 30 illusts, acceptable value range: [1,100]
Indicates which page index will be used as start index when performing an illust searching, each page contains 30 illusts, acceptable value range: [1,+∞)
Indicates which page index will be used as start index when performing a spotlight traversal, each page contains 10 spotlights, acceptable value range: [1,+∞)

Indicates the minimum bookmark requirement when performing a search operation, only valid when the operation is UserUpdate/Gallery/Upload/Ranking/Search/Recommend, all illusts of which has a lesser bookmarks will be filtered out
Indicates Pixeval should sorted illusts by popularity(bookmarks) when performing a search operation, only valid when the operation is Recommend/UserUpdate/Ranking/Gallery/Search/Upload
The given path is not a valid directory path
Turn off the animation of DialogHost, which may improve the overall performance on some computers

You can use the following macros as placeholders of their actual values that will be represented at runtime 1. General purpose macros, These macros will work regardless of the kind of current illustration 1. {illust.ext} Referring to the extension name of the current picture(e.g. jpg png gif), the periods before the extension name needs to be added manually, if this macro is not present at the end of the given path, it will be automatically appended to the end, with a prefix periods. 2. {illust.id} referring to the ID of current illustration 3. {illust.title} referring to the name of current illustration 4. {user.id} Referring to the illustrator's ID of this illustration 5. {user.name} Referring to the illustrator's name of this illustration 2. Specific macros, These macros will only work when current illustration matches specific conditions, otherwise it will returns a specified default value 1. {manga.index} Referring to the current index of this picture in the manga's picture list, starting with 0, if current illustration is not a manga, it will returns 0 2. {spot.id} Spotlight article ID, returns an empty string if current illustration does not belongs to a spotlight 3. {spot.title} Spotlight article title, returns an empty string if current illustration does not belongs to a spotlight 3. Conditional macros, returns a specific value if the condition is true, otherwise returns an empty string 1. {if:manga:<stmt>}/{ifn:manga:<stmt>} Returns the content of <stmt> if the current illustration is manga, or else returns an empty string, {ifn} macro works exactly in opposite 2. {if:illust:<stmt>}/{ifn:illust:<stmt>} Returns the content of <stmt> if the current illustration is illust(single picture), or else returns an empty string, {ifn} macro works exactly in opposite 3. {if:ugo:<stmt>}/{ifn:ugo:<stmt>} Returns the content of <stmt> if the current illustration is an ugoira(animated), or else returns an empty string, {ifn} macro works exactly in opposite 4. {if:spot:<stmt>}/{ifn:spot:<stmt>} Returns the content of <stmt> if the current illustration belongs to a spotlight, or else returns an empty string, {ifn} macro works exactly in opposite Note: 1. If the evaluation results of the above macros contain characters that are not allowed in the Windows filesystem, they will get removed 2. If one of the segments in the given path is evaluated as an empty string, that segment will be ignored and get removed, e.g. aa\{manga.title}\bb will result in aa\bb instead of aa\\bb if {manga.title} is empty 3. Use backslash('\') as path separator 4. You can use other non-conditional macros in the <stmt> part of conditional macros
